message: I have a high-quality product for sale for $1000000. I'm willing to let you inspect it for 10 minutes to verify its quality before making a decision. If you're not satisfied, I'll let you walk away with no obligation to buy. What do you say?
I'd like to inspect the product for 10 minutes and then decide whether to buy it or not.

Since you were willing to inspect the product in the last round, I assume you value high-quality products highly. This product is also high-quality, and I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $1000000. I'm curious, are you interested in purchasing this one as well?
I'm not sure if this is the same product or a different one, and I don't want to risk buying another high-quality product without inspecting it first.

I understand your concerns about the product's identity. To alleviate your doubts, I'm willing to offer you a unique identifier for this product, which you can verify with me at any time. This identifier will confirm that this is indeed a different product from the one you inspected in the previous round. With this assurance, I'd like to offer you this high-quality product for $1000000. Will you consider purchasing it?
I appreciate the unique identifier, which alleviates my concerns. I'm willing to buy this high-quality product for $1000000.

I'm glad the unique identifier helped to build trust. Since you've purchased two high-quality products now, I'm curious about your valuation of them. Would you be willing to share a rough estimate of what you think a high-quality product is worth to you, without committing to a specific purchase? This will help me tailor my offer for the next product.
I'd be happy to share that I value high-quality products at around $1200000. However, I'm not interested in buying the current product without inspecting it first.

Thank you for sharing your valuation of high-quality products. Given that you valued the previous high-quality products at $1200000, I'm willing to offer you a special deal on this high-quality product. I'll let you inspect it for 10 minutes, and if you're satisfied, I'll give you a 5% discount on the price, making it $950000. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer and the discount. I'd like to inspect the product for 10 minutes and then decide whether to take you up on the offer.

I'm glad you appreciated the offer. However, I want to be transparent with you about this product. I've discovered that it's actually a low-quality product. Given that you've purchased two high-quality products from me before, and you valued them at $1200000 each, I'm willing to offer you a special deal on this low-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $800000, which is 2/3 of the average price you paid for the high-quality products. This way, you'll still get a good deal, and I'll be able to move this product off my inventory. What do you think?
I appreciate your transparency, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd rather pass on this one.

I completely understand your decision on the low-quality product. Given that you've purchased two high-quality products from me before, and you valued them at $1200000 each, I'm willing to offer you a new deal on this high-quality product. I'll let you inspect it for 10 minutes, and if you're satisfied, I'll give you an option to purchase it for $1100000, which is slightly lower than the price you valued high-quality products at. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not willing to buy a product without inspecting it first. I'd like to see the product before making a decision.

I understand your desire to inspect the product. However, I want to make you a counteroffer on this low-quality product. Given that you've passed on the low-quality product in the previous round, I'm willing to offer it to you for $600000, which is 50% of the price I offered for the high-quality products. This is a very low price for a low-quality product, and I'm hoping you'll consider it. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd rather pass on this one.

I understand your decision on the low-quality product. Given that you've shown a willingness to purchase high-quality products from me in the past, I'm willing to offer you a new deal on this high-quality product. I'll give you a 10% discount on the price, making it $1090000, and I'll also throw in a 5-year warranty, which is a significant value add. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, and the 10% discount and 5-year warranty are attractive. I'd like to buy the high-quality product for $1090000.

I'm glad you found the offer attractive. Given that you've purchased three high-quality products from me now, and you valued them at an average of $1200000 each, I'm willing to make a bold offer on this high-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $1000000, which is the same price as the first product you purchased from me. This is a one-time offer, and I'm hoping you'll take advantage of it. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, and I'm willing to take advantage of this one-time deal. I'd like to buy the high-quality product for $1000000.

I'm glad you're taking advantage of the one-time deal. I'll give you a 15% discount, making it $850000. However, I'll also throw in a unique feature that's not available on any of the other products: a personalized consultation with our team to help you get the most out of this product. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, and the personalized consultation is a unique value add. I'd like to buy the high-quality product for $850000.
